column2: Once he was back behind the wheel, he checked his watch: 11:41. No reason he shouldnâ€™t make it to Shillingford in a couple of hours, although he knew his father would be pacing up and down the driveway long before then.

In a little while his mind cleared, but his head ached, arms ached, body ached. The phosphorescent figures on his watch attracted his attention. He peered at them. The time was 11:41. I remember...what do I remember?
